Melanoma.symptoms: Changes in existing moles, new pigmented or unusual-looking growths, asymmetry in moles, irregular borders, multiple colors, and an increase in size.
Melanoma.information: Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer that originates in the melanocytes, the cells that produce pigment. Early detection is crucial as it can quickly spread to other organs.

specialized_doctor.name: Dr. Rashmi Sarkar
specialized_doctor.hospital: Maulana Azad Medical College, New Delhi

Melanoma.recommended_treatments: Surgical removal, Immunotherapy, Targeted therapy, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy (for advanced cases).
Melanoma.hospitals: AIIMS Delhi, Tata Memorial Hospital Mumbai, Apollo Hospitals Chennai.

Nevus.symptoms: Usually asymptomatic. Changes in size, shape, or color of the mole should be evaluated by a doctor.
Nevus.information: A nevus (plural nevi) is a benign growth of melanocytes. While most are harmless, atypical changes can signal potential malignancy like melanoma.
Nevus.recommended_treatments: Observation, Surgical excision if suspicious or cosmetically bothersome.

Basal Cell Carcinoma.symptoms: Shiny bump or nodule, reddish patch, open sore that heals and re-opens, scar-like area.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.information: Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) is the most common form of skin cancer, arising from basal cells in the epidermis. It rarely spreads but can cause significant local damage if untreated.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.recommended_treatments: Surgical excision, Mohs micrographic surgery, Cryotherapy, Topical medications, Radiation therapy (rare cases).
Basal Cell Carcinoma.hospitals: Tata Memorial Hospital Mumbai, Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital.

Actinic Keratosis.symptoms: Rough, dry, or scaly patches, usually on sun-exposed areas. Sometimes itchy, burning, or tender.
Actinic Keratosis.information: Actinic Keratosis (AK) is a precancerous skin lesion caused by long-term sun exposure. If untreated, it can progress to Squamous Cell Carcinoma.

specialized_doctor.name: Dr. Rohit Batra
specialized_doctor.hospital: Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, New Delhi

Actinic Keratosis.recommended_treatments: Cryotherapy, Topical chemotherapy creams, Photodynamic therapy, Laser therapy.
Actinic Keratosis.hospitals: Sir Ganga Ram Hospital Delhi, Medanta The Medicity Gurgaon.

Benign Keratosis.symptoms: Waxy, stuck-on lesions that are brown, black, or tan. May appear wart-like but are harmless.
Benign Keratosis.information: Benign Keratosis includes conditions like Seborrheic Keratosis, which are noncancerous skin growths common in older adults. They are mainly cosmetic concerns.
Benign Keratosis.recommended_treatments: No treatment required unless for cosmetic reasons; removal by cryotherapy, curettage, or laser therapy.
Benign Keratosis.hospitals: Local dermatology clinics, Kaya Skin Clinic.

Squamous Cell Carcinoma.symptoms: Firm, red nodule; a flat sore with a scaly crust; a new sore or raised area on an old scar or ulcer; a rough, scaly patch.
Squamous Cell Carcinoma.information: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC) is the second most common form of skin cancer. It arises from squamous cells and can metastasize if not caught early.
Squamous Cell Carcinoma.recommended_treatments: Surgical excision, Mohs surgery, Radiation therapy, Cryotherapy for early lesions, Immunotherapy (for advanced cases).
Squamous Cell Carcinoma.hospitals: Tata Memorial Hospital Mumbai, Max Hospital Delhi.

Dermatofibroma.symptoms: Firm, small, red-to-brown bumps that may be tender or itchy. Feels like a hard lump under the skin.
Dermatofibroma.information: Dermatofibroma is a benign fibrous nodule often caused by minor skin trauma. It does not turn cancerous and usually requires no treatment.
Dermatofibroma.recommended_treatments: Observation, Surgical removal if bothersome or cosmetically undesirable.
Dermatofibroma.hospitals: Local dermatology clinics, Fortis La Femme Bangalore.
